intro: Pedicularis anserantha, commonly known as the goosefoot lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in pairs along the stem. Pedicularis anserantha is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
